doc.field: Willkie, Wendell - Correspondence Between Russell Davenport and HRL
Willkie, Wendell - Correspondence Between Russell Davenport and HRL

Contains mostly telegrams and carbon copies of correspondence, memoranda, and notes dealing with Willkie's 1940 presidential campaign. Includes a memorandum from C. L. Stillman to HRL regarding an interview with Mr. Stettinius, a carbon copy of the Winston Churchill speech "What We Ask of the United States," an itinerary for the Willkie Special Train, drafts of speeches to be made in Buffalo and St. Louis, and a printed memorandum from Chester J. La Roche "The 'Break-Through' Problem and a Plan to Solve It: The American Partnership Plan."
Series V. Subject Name Files >> Subseries V.B. Name Files B >> Willkie, Wendell - Correspondence Between Russell Davenport and HRL
